org.jcatapult.domain
Class AuditableImpl

java.lang.Object
  org.jcatapult.domain.IdentifiableImpl
      org.jcatapult.domain.TimeStampableImpl
          org.jcatapult.domain.AuditableImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Auditable, Identifiable, TimeStampable
Direct Known Subclasses:
AuditableSoftDeletableImpl
public abstract class AuditableImpl
extends TimeStampableImpl
implements Auditable

This class is an auditing persistable Object instance. Since Java is lacking multiple inheritance I had to force this to extend TimeStampableImpl since that will be the most common case. This means that AuditableImpl will not have the ability to handle objects with natural keys or other types of keys or not have time stamp information.

The user information is pulled from the SecurityContext.

See Also:

getInsertUser

public String getInsertUser()

Specified by:
getInsertUser in interface Auditable
Returns:
The user that inserted this entity, null if the entity is transient or so type of signifier if the entity was inserted by someone anonymous.

setInsertUser

public void setInsertUser(String insertUser)
Sets the user that inserted this entity. This should be set to a signifier if the entity is being inserted by an anonymous user.

Specified by:
setInsertUser in interface Auditable
Parameters:
insertUser - The insert user.

getUpdateUser

public String getUpdateUser()

Specified by:
getUpdateUser in interface Auditable
Returns:
The user that updated this entity last, null if the entity is transient or so type of signifier if the entity was updated by someone anonymous.

Sets the user that updated this entity. This should be set to a signifier if the entity is being updated by an anonymous user.
